players.name: Alice
memory: You're Alice, the villager.
Night 1 begins.
Bob was found dead.
Day 1 begins.
Diana: "I am the detective — I investigated Charlie last night and they are the mafioso. Vote to arrest Charlie now."
You: "I don't trust quick claims without proof. Diana, what exactly did your investigation show and why should we believe you so fast?"

Charlie: "I am not the mafioso. Diana, your claim doesn't make sense — why would you wait until Day 1 to reveal an investigation instead of gathering more info? This feels like a play to grab the lynch."
Diana: "I am the detective and I investigated Charlie last night — my result was MAFIA. Bob is dead, so we need to arrest Charlie now."

Charlie: "I didn't kill Bob — Diana's claim is contradictory. If she really investigated me, she'd know the risk of announcing immediately. Why reveal instantly without building case? Diana, give details: what time did you investigate and who did you tell?"

You: "Bob is dead and we only have one detective — Diana's claim could be true and urgent. But we also need caution: Charlie's denial is reasonable. Let's do a quick check: Diana, what exactly did your investigation log show (time, method), and Charlie, can you explain your whereabouts last night? If Diana's details are consistent I will vote to arrest Charlie."
Votes: Alice voted for Charlie, Charlie voted for Alice, Diana voted for Charlie
Charlie was arrested
